description: From French récupérer. Doublet of recuperate and recover.

verbs.description: recoup (third-person singular simple present recoups, present participle recouping, simple past and past participle recouped)

entries.meaning: To make back, as an investment.
examples: He barely managed to recoup his money. He sold out for just what he had invested.
to recoup losses made at the gaming table

entries.meaning: (law) To keep back rightfully (a part), as if by cutting off, so as to diminish a sum due; to take off (a part) from damages; to deduct.
examples: A landlord recouped the rent of premises from damages awarded to the plaintiff for eviction.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To reimburse; to indemnify; often used reflexively and in the passive.
examples: Elizabeth had lost her venture; but if she was bold, she might recoup herself at Philip's cost.
